intro: Randia oaxacana, commonly known as Oaxacan randia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, simple leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its small, white or pink flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the summer months. Randia oaxacana is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
